passage_text: For example the median expected annual pay for a typical Six Sigma Black Belt in the United States is $99,110 so 50% of the people who perform the job of Six Sigma Black Belt in the United States are expected to make less than $99,110. Source: HR Reported data as of October 2015. Median $99,110. 1  Salary.

Lean Six Sigma Black Belt average salary is $78,649, median salary is $77,896 with a salary range from $60,000 to $95,000. Lean Six Sigma Black Belt salaries are collected from government agencies and companies. Each salary is associated with a real job position.

Earning the title of Master Six Sigma Black Belt can increase the average annual salary to $132,500. With 15 years of experience, the Master Six Sigma Black Belt can earn up to $202,500 annually. Salaries of these amounts are not guaranteed by Six Sigma and can vary due to location.

In the United States, Lean Six Sigma Black Belts working in the Western subregion reported the highest average salary at $95,648. 1  Those in the Northeast states earn $92,394 in annual pay. 2  Lean Six Sigma Black Belt working in the Central and Southern subregions reported an average salary of approximately $90,000 a year.

Lean Six Sigma Black Belts earn an average of $83,107 per year, not including bonuses. After several years of relatively flat numbers, the average worldwide Lean Six Sigma Black Belt salary rose to $83,107, up 5 percent over the previous year (Figure 4).
Lean Six Sigma Black Belts employed in the United States and Europe earn average annual salaries of $92,157 and $76,944, respectively.
The annual salary for someone with the job title Six Sigma Black Belt may vary depending on a number of factors including industry, company size, location, years of experience and level of education.
